metadata.title: Fulminant hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis secondary to a reactivated EBV infection: A case report

abstract.original_text: Hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis (HLH) is an aggressive inflammatory syndrome that results from inappropriate activation of the immune system. HLH has a high mortality if not treated. We describe a case of a fulminant HLH, associated with a reactivation of an EBV infection. The patient responded well to steroid treatment.
